itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Glyndwr "Glyn" Shaw (born 11 April 1951) is a Welsh dual-code international rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Neath RFC, as a prop, i.e. number 1 or 3, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Great Britain and Wales, and at club level for Widnes, Wigan (Heritage № 778), Warrington (Warrington № 848) and Rochdale Hornets, as a prop, or second-row, i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested scrums.
